description: 16 separate leaves between thin wood covers; covers decorated with organic and geometric forms in red on gold; movable red cloth band around each cover; gold and red leaves with text
text: The early Burmese Buddhist religious texts called Kammawa-sa date from the Pagan period (1044â€“1287). In this much later example, a thick, glossy black lacquer known as "tamarind seed" is used to write on a folded, lacquered cloth with silver or gold leaf decoration. Such texts were also displayed and stored in areas designated for monastic rites.
title: Lacquered Book (Kammawa-sa)
